title: Zeke's Harbinger passive on Ashe
body:
"At maximum Charges, causing damage consumes all Charges and increases you and your ally's Ability Power by 20% and Critical Strike chance by 50% for 6 seconds."

How does this work with Ashes crit?

replies.body:
> [{quoted}](name=Gekko,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=APBxrAqb,comment-id=,timestamp=2015-07-23T20:51:16.315+0000)
>
> How does this work with Ashes crit?

It means that if your Q is charged and you have IE + PD you can Q for 5 crits in a row. Enjoy :)
Proof you don't know how Ashe works now.

> [{quoted}](name=JasonWazza,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=APBxrAqb,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-07-24T05:19:45.853+0000)
>
> Proof you don't know how Ashe works now.

Mate I know that you live on this board, but how about offer some constructive analysis, instead of writing people off. I stand by what I said. Is it not 100% crit chance now, if Ashe's Q is charged?
Ashe's new passive changes how her crit works all together. She will crit on every AA on a target with her slow on them, but at reduced crit damage. Buying crit chance instead raises her crit damage.

Well for the next 6 seconds ashe's crit chance like anyone would increase by 50%. So yea it could be bugged, but i doubt it, ashe's passive would just look at the TOTAL current crit chance AND crit damage and work out the damage it does, so for next 6 seconds you would gain 50% crit chance to the however the passive calculates the dps.
The assumption would be, like adding 50% crit to your build, however that could very well be bugged because Rito and their fringe cases never have that good of an understanding.
